lines.text: Now, where were we? Oh yes... Your name.
[pause]
You know, if you want, I can call the cops right now.
Robert.
Robert. And what's your last name, Robert?
Breed.

Breed. Let me ask you something, Robert... What kind of 'breed' are you? The car thief breed, hmm? The something for nothing breed? How many cars have you stolen this year, Robert? 10, 50, 100, hmm? Answer me.
A few.
A few? Well that's kind of vague, isn't it, Robert? A few? Do you know what they do in Turkey, Robert, to car thieves?
[Makes scissoring motion with hand]
They chop off a finger for every car. How would you like to lose a few fingers?

[Opening lines; dialog intersperses with Holden and the news]
I can't believe it! My life's work is being held hostage by some overgrown civil servant? I'm not going to let him get away with this, Harry! No way!
Early this afternoon, Superior Court Judge Walter Braniff issued a preliminary court injunction against the massive Millennium City project, brainchild of developer Holden Downs.
Harry, this Judge Braniff. Do you know him?
[pause]
Well, do you know anybody that does know him? Yeah, like a friend!
[pause]
Somebody that can talk to him, Harry!
[pause]
There's gotta be somebody who can talk to him!

Within an hour of the ruling, construction at the site came grinding to a virtual standstill, and will remain that way until later this week, when Judge Braniff rules on whether or not to lift the injunction.

What do you mean he won't abort the ruling? I can't have my crew sitting idle all week! Listen to me, Harry. There's a number going through my head; it's 68,493 dollars a day, Harry! That's what it's costing me a day. A DAY!
You cannot build Millennium City and destroy the environment.

Do I want you to call the mayor? Do I want you to inconvenience him? Gee, I don't know Paul, you tell me! There's only thousands of jobs at stake! This could only be my entire life at stake! Maybe I should bend over and let everybody take a shot!
[hangs up]
Dammit!
[activates buzzer at intercom]
Cindy, get me Bob over at city hall! How much more of this can I take?
Listen. You hear or see anybody, you walk away.

[mutters]
Yeah.
Joey, do you hear me?
Put on a dress, you're gonna start looking like mom. You know what I'm saying?
[chuckles]
How am I feeling? Oh, other than this ulcer I'm just great - great.
Hey Downs! That car is mine, asshole!
Buddy, I got a big problem. Those bastards have threatened to come back to get this.
[Points at car]
You're kidding me.
Yeah. I wish I had my gun with me.
Wow. What - What do you want me to do?
Look. I want you to make sure that nobody can get into this. I want you to create something that they cannot crack.

[Nods]
Okay.
I'll pay anything. Just make sure you can stop 'em.
You know what?
[chuckles]
I think I can actually do you one better than that.
What do you mean?
You'll see. Still formulating it but uh... I'll call you.
I understand Mr. Mayor, you - you can't get involved.

[over phone]
I'm sorry.
There's just one thing I want to say to you, and that is... Fuck you.
Holden, please...
If I could take back every cent that I contributed to your shitty campaign, I would do it in a heartbeat.
[hangs up]
Hey Tanner!
I got nothing to say to you, Downs.
You're a self-seeking carnival act. I'm going to find every one of those frogs and I'm gonna eat 'em!
Holden, please...

[Rinses blood off car after cutting off Robert's fingers]
Now everyone in Turkey will know you're a thief.

[after seeing Joey]
I just found a cockroach in my house.

[after Robert attempts to wrestle for gun, Holden traps Robert's arm in the window]
You know what really, really gets me, Robert, huh? Nobody gives a damn. That's what really gets me. Serving up the judges, serving up the juries, and even if you do get caught, you end up in jail for a litle while, then you're back on the street stealing, raping, murdering a lot of innocent people.
[leans in]
Well, Mr. Breed. There will be no more stealing for you.
[pause]
Now, you are going to learn that there are certain consequences to your actions, and I am going to be the one to teach you. You're going to spend a little jail time with me.
This isn't jail, asshole! This is kidnapping! And the last I checked this is a fucking crime!
No, no, no. This is not kidnapping, this is called... House arrest, and it's the duty of every red-blooded American citizen.
[Frees Robert's hand from the window]
Good night.

[Whispers]
Fucking psycho.
[shouts]
You're a fucking psycho! You are one twisted-up asshole, Downs! You're screwed up!
I'm screwed up? Let's give it a day and we'll compare notes.
[Shuts off lights and blasts radio]

[Comes in with plate of bread and cup of water]
Well, good morning sunshine. How did you like my new stereo system? Music that has power to soothe the savage beast.
[sniffs]
Hmm. There's a distinct stench coming from there, have you been marking your territory?
I pissed on your precious upholstery.
How rodent-like of you. Well, I'm sure that the stench is going to bother you more than it's gonna bother me. Oh, I got you some breakfast. Bread and water. Brot und Wasser. Hmm. Bon Appétit.

[laughing hysterically and pointing at plate]
A rich bastard like you and that's all I get?
You're not too bright, are you?
[Drops everything on the floor and starts randomly turning his hands]
Oops, I'm sorry.
Why did you do that?
[shouts louder]
Why did you do that?
Involuntary muscle reflex... That happens every time I hear ingratitude. Now, I'm going to leave the window open just a little crack, I wouldn't want you to become pot roast.

[Stammers]
You can't leave me in here, you can't leave me in here.
Watch me. Have a nice day. Sorry I can't stay and chat, got an appointment with the judge this morning. Think positive thoughts for me, Robert, OK?
I'll tell you what I want. I want to know something...
[Grittingly]

What gives you... The right... To steal from me? The things that I have earned, that I have worked so hard for. Hmm? Now, at the very, very least, you should ask. Not steal. Go ahead. Ask me for my car.
Not today.

[Unrolls window, points gun at Robert's head and shouts]
I said ask!

[shouting]
Relax!
[pause]
Can I have your car?

[Whispers]
No.
[normal]
No, no.

[Grabs bolt from shelf and a chair]
So, what do you say we acquainted, huh? Hmm?
[pause]
What's your name?
[pause]
Answer me?
Fuck you.
'Fuck you?' Your name is 'fuck you'? What kind of name is that?
My name is 'fuck you',
[holds up imaginary driver's license]
You see right right here on my license? My name says
[shouting]
'FUCK YOU!'

[rolls down window, juggles bolt several times before throwing it at Robert's face]
AHH!
[Phone rings]
Now you sit here and - and you try to remember your name. 'Kay?
[shuts window]
